<h3><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Short Bio:<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p>I joined <a href="http://www.uci.edu/">UCI</a> as an assistant
professor in the <a href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/">School of
Information and Computer Sciences</a> in July 2003.  In June 2001
I graduated from the <a href="http://www.lcs.mit.edu">MIT
Computer Science</a> PhD program, where I studied cryptography under the
guidance of Prof. <a href="http://theory.lcs.mit.edu/~shafi">Shafi Goldwasser</a>. 
Between MIT and UCI, I first worked at <a
href="http://www.intertrust.com/">Intertrust</a>'s "StarLab", a small
research lab in the Silicon Valley company which was developing Digital Rights
Management systems, and then I spent a year as a postdoc at the <a
href="http://crypto.stanford.edu/">applied cryptography group</a> led by prof. <a
href="http://theory.stanford.edu/~dabo">Dan Boneh</a>  at Stanford. </p>
